1.long: freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery.
I stand fast, stand firm, persevere.

1.brief: again, further, on the other hand
1.long: again, back, once more, further, on the other hand.

1.brief: a yoke, heavy burden, pair of scales
1.long: a yoke; hence met: (a Jewish idea) of a heavy burden, comparable to the heavy yokes resting on the bullocks' necks; a balance, pair of scales.
(a) I have a grudge against, am angry (with), (b) pass. or mid: I am entangled, entangle myself.

2.long: I see, look upon, experience, perceive, discern, beware.

that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
I help, benefit, do good, am useful (to), profit.

3.brief: I call to witness, testify, solemnly charge
3.long: (properly: I call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) I testify, protest, asseverate; I conjure, solemnly charge.

3.brief: but, on the other hand, and
3.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

3.brief: again, further, on the other hand
3.long: again, back, once more, further, on the other hand.

3.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
3.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

3.brief: a man, one of the human race
3.long: a man, one of the human race.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
(a) a debtor, one who owes, one who is indebted, (b) one who has sinned against another (an Aramaism), a sinner.

usage, custom, law; in NT: of law in general, plur: of divine laws; of a force or influence impelling to action; of the Mosaic law; meton: of the books which contain the law, the Pentateuch, the Old Testament scriptures in general.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.

4.brief: I bring to naught, sever, abolish
4.long: (a) I make idle (inactive), make of no effect, annul, abolish, bring to naught, (b) I discharge, sever, separate from.

usage, custom, law; in NT: of law in general, plur: of divine laws; of a force or influence impelling to action; of the Mosaic law; meton: of the books which contain the law, the Pentateuch, the Old Testament scriptures in general.

4.brief: I make righteous, defend the cause of, justify
4.long: I make righteous, defend the cause of, plead for the righteousness (innocence) of, acquit, justify; hence: I regard as righteous.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.

4.brief: I fall out, fall off, fall away, fade away, wither away
4.long: I fall out, fall off, fall away; hence in nautical language: I fall off from the straight course; of flowers: I fade away, wither away; I fall from, lose, forfeit; I am cast ashore; I am fruitless.

5.brief: from out, out from among, from
5.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
(usually if not always in a Jewish atmosphere), justice, justness, righteousness, righteousness of which God is the source or author, but practically: a divine righteousness.

5.brief: I expect eagerly, wait for eagerly
5.long: I expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for.

6.long: Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
I have strength, am strong, am in full health and vigor, am able; meton: I prevail.
(a technical word of Jewish use) foreskin, prepuce: used sometimes as a slang term by Jews, of Gentiles.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
(a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.
I work, am operative, am at work, am made to work, accomplish; mid: I work, display activity.

7.long: I run, exercise myself, make progress.
truth, but not merely truth as spoken; truth of idea, reality, sincerity, truth in the moral sphere, divine truth revealed to man, straightforwardness.

8.long: persuasion, conviction, a yielding to persuasion.

8.brief: from out, out from among, from
8.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
(a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name.

9.long: leaven, ferment, both lit. and met.
a mass or lump, as of bread dough.

10.long: into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
other, another (of more than two), different.

10.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
I disturb, agitate, stir up, trouble.
(a) I carry, bear, (b) I carry (take) away.
(a) a judgment, a verdict; sometimes implying an adverse verdict, a condemnation, (b) a case at law, a lawsuit.

a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

for.
